key_title: Key to the varieties of Senecio pectinatus

source.author: Thompson, I.R
source.title: Taxonomic studies of Australian Senecio (Asteraceae): 3. Radiate, arid region species allied to S. magnificus and the radiate, alpine species S. pectinatus.
source.citation: From: Thompson, I.R (2004c). Taxonomic studies of Australian Senecio (Asteraceae): 3. Radiate, arid region species allied to S. magnificus and the radiate, alpine species S. pectinatus.. Muelleria 20:111-138.

leads.lead_text: Scape less than 1.5 mm diam.; rosette leaves 1–5(–8) cm long; involucre 6–8 mm long, usually less than 15 mm wide when pressed; corolla of disc florets less than 6 mm long
Scape greater than 1.5 mm diam.; rosette leaves 4–15 cm long; involucre 8–12 mm long, usually greater than 15 mm wide when pressed; corolla of disc florets greater than 6 mm long
